lexUnit.name: cruel.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: disregarding or taking pleasure in the pain or suffering of others.

sentence.text: What we perceive , however , as cruel treatment is not universally shared and for many non-Westerners , our behaviour seems strangely contradictory .
Beccaria opposed capital punishment as being cruel and inefficient as a deterrent .
Let me show you that all men are n't as cruel and immature as your retarded merchant banker .
How cruel to be stealing presents obviously meant for children . "
` How cruel you are in speaking thus , my lord ! " she said reproachfully , having no defence against such an argument .
But I remembered how cruel children can be to small animals , and I did not want the boy to take his revenge on me .
How could his kidnappers be so cruel and not explain their reasons why ?
Most of the gags are offensive and cruel but some are very funny indeed .
People bought her lunch and rang her up and sent her birthday cards ; it seemed a particularly cruel joke that one of the few people who really did dislike her should be married to her .
Several factors have made the abuse particularly cruel and degrading .
I must admit , it was rather cruel of me to take advantage of your amiable nature .
` My conversation with him this evening made me realise that he can be quite devious , and also that he has a rather cruel sense of humour .
He had been too cruel to her .
The RSPCA says magistrates are too soft on people who are cruel to animals .
In some ways , life must seem to be a very cruel joke to millions of people on this earth .
He ca n't go to Australia and hide because they hammer him there -- the press there are very cruel .
Some of our friends and neighbours were very cruel to me .
` She was very frightened of her cruel husband , but she suspected that he was responsible for Sir Charles " death .
She had an obstinate chin , a cruel mouth and small arrogant eyes .
She imagined Merlyn watching with her cruel eyes and Oliver being silently attentive and Cobalt quietly playing whatever game he was playing .
For an agonising moment it felt as if she was naked again , under the intent , laughing scrutiny of those cruel grey eyes .
He hated Big Tom Fish , with his cruel jokes and flashing green eyes and rough workman 's hands .
David stared at the words open-mouthed , his eyes tracing the line of each letter , fearful that he was the subject of some cruel practical joke .
The gods were enjoying their own cruel joke !
Mr Wilcock told the bench that Mr Smith was not a cruel man , and that it was not his intention to cause his animals suffering .
In the case of an only moderately cruel man , the intensification of the pain beyond a certain point will suddenly switch him to the equalization of viewpoints , and his pleasure will lapse .
Archelaus was a cruel man and Joseph has no wish to live under his rule .
Pepe has a lot in common with Boris , thought Ellis : they 're both strong , cruel men without decency or compassion .
A cruel smile played at the corners of his mouth .
A cruel , mocking smile curved his lips , and he took a couple of steps towards her .
Shostakovich , obviously pre-eminent among Soviet composers , had to bear the cruellest treatment .
Traders get away with such cruel treatment because of the general lack of control and concern on the part of airlines and airports .
His cruel treatment of her in Act III , Scene I is not directed at her personally , but at the ruthlessness of Claudius ' power over her and treatment of her .
He shook his head sadly at the cruel injustices of this world .

It seems cruel that what is encouraged and praised in girls as children ( and is also , after all , an expression of identity and creativity which little boys too could benefit from ) is suddenly , at age eleven seen as vanity , and a sign of low intellect .
It was cruel of Miss Havisham to encourage me to hope , but I do n't think she meant to be unkind . "
It was cruel to lock me in there alone without a candle .
` It 's cruel of you to try to force me into this family .
It was cruel to take my annoyance out on Rose .
Is it cruel to have a cat de-clawed ?
` This is all I shall have to remember him by -- you are cruel to treat it with such levity . "
Fabia felt it might be a touch cruel to laugh at him again but , feeling certain he would run a mile if she took him seriously , she was a little nonplussed about how to answer him .

His expression wicked , he continued the stare which seemed to strip poor McAllister of her clothing , a stare so cruel that Dr Neil immediately saw its import and began to bridle at the sight , putting out a protective hand to his beloved , to feel her tremble beneath it .
Cruel in the extreme , she would horsewhip them mercilessly , giving them little food and confining them in cold and filthy cellars .
` All over the world today children are starving , men and women are being cruel to one another and killing one another .
Where members of staff are unkind or even cruel to children or even other staff swift disciplinary action needs to be taken .
If he is unable to breathe spontaneously it would be cruel to subject him to positive pressure ventilation to prolong his life artificially .
No I will not be cruel , you can not be cruel with them .
Most unlucky are those ghosts of people who were violent or cruel during their lifetime .
That seemed cruel beyond belief , he should have been there instead of Hodge .
` Surely , no one could be so cruel as to deliberately set out to starve a child to death ? "
Even today , she does n't think he was being cruel in doing that .
Labour demands for the Government to impose credit controls instead of high interest rates to curb borrowing were ` a cruel deception " because they were unworkable .
The cruel killings of real or imagined collaborators have helped restore this image , yet who has forgotten that Jews executed traitors during their own struggle for national liberation ?
Harbour commissioner Frank Sluman said : ` The sea is a cruel master and it takes its toll over the years . "
She absorbed the deliberate irony , the cruel banter , with growing resentment .
I am sure that to conceal from a child the fact that he is adopted is both foolish and cruel .
Although he was more in control of his temper than had been his predecessor , Miloš was cruel , greedy , corrupt , devious and also illiterate .
His expression was calculating , perhaps cruel .
Such harsh methods are not only cruel and completely unnecessary , but they destroy the horse .
Just remember there are people out there who will be cruel and unpleasant to you .
And I had never heard a voice so cruel and cold .
But the culture can be not only cruel but stupid .
